author: Heather Mack
title: Luma Health Raises $6 Million for Doctor-Patient Message Software
text:
Luma Health Inc., which makes software for two-way communication between doctors and patients, has raised $6.3 million in Series A funding.
U.S. Venture Partners led the round, which brings the San Francisco-based company’s total funding to date to about $9.7 million. The financing will be used to develop more capabilities of the software and expand Luma’s customer base. Currently, the software is in use in about 200 clinics across the United States.
